title: US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
subhead: The president, who hosted industry representatives at the White House on Friday, urged them to rapidly invest in the South American country to exploit its vast reserves and guaranteed them Washington's protection.

title: 'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat
EU-Mercosur agreement: Five key questions about where things stand
subhead: The commercial agreement is set to be officially signed on Monday after France failed to block its adoption. However, doubts remain about whether it will actually come into effect.

title: What the US withdrawal from international bodies means for climate change and biodiversity
subhead: The US's exit from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and its equivalent for biodiversity threatens to further slow and hinder the fight against environmental crises.

title: Venezuela says in talks with US to restore diplomatic ties
subhead: The government of the South American country's interim President Delcy Rodriguez 'has decided to initiate an exploratory diplomatic process' with the US government, 'aimed at re-establishing diplomatic missions in both countries,' Foreign Minister Yvan Gil said in a statement.

title: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
subhead: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

title: Annika's conversion to Sufism: 'For years, I limited myself to practicing the whirling dervish dance, trying to convince myself that Islam did not interest me'

'Love Is Blind: France' contestants sue over 'inhuman or degrading treatment' during filming
subhead: Three participants in the French version of Netflix reality TV show have brought their case before a Paris-region labor court, claiming they were deprived of their personal freedoms during the filming of the show.

title: 'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
subhead: Europe finds itself in a perilous phase, having recognized its solitude but lacking the means for true autonomy, while the emotion created by the aggressiveness of empires calls for a response, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Gaza's grandparents, shattered pillars of a traumatized society
subhead: Elderly people, whose health is often fragile and mobility reduced, feel as if they are reliving the tragedy of the Nakba, the forced exodus of Palestinians during the creation of Israel in 1948.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
Greenland is and must remain European
